Alexandra Russia/ France 94 minutes

Please note the film starts at 4:25. Due to the limitations of the Meetup Site, I could choose to post either 4:15 or 4:30 as the starting time.

A film of startling originality and beauty . NY Times

A Russian matriarch visits her grandson, a soldier, at his desolate camp somewhere in Chechnya. Not much happens during her stay - she interacts with the young recruits and makes friends with a Chechen woman. But in the hands of visionary filmmaker Alexander Sokurov, this simple material makes for a haunting drama about war, generational relationships and the human condition. SF Chronicle

Alexander Sokurov has been one of Russia's top directors for the past 20 years, best known in this country for the films The Russian Ark and Mother and Son. Alexandra may be his finest work to date.

Spare yet tactile, a mysterious mixture of lightness and gravity. Village Voice

Heres a link to the NY Times review: http://movies.nytimes...

Hope to see you there ,

Tom
item.how_to_find_us: Tom will be holding a meetup sign near the front row at the film's conclusion and then we'll go to a nearby restaurant for our group discussion.
